f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:20): I guess it's good to see more free alternatives, along with Ogg, Matroska, Theora, Dirac and Vorbis. Though having too many competing technologies can be someone counter productive

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (02:22): at least over the long term
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:22): eek, they're also doing Project DReaM :-( http://www.openmediacommons.org/

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (02:23): one big goal of any serious codec effort should be to get widspread support for at the hardware level on devices, particularly mobile devices and other constrained devices

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:23): I think in the video market, there have been far too many competing technologies, which probably had a lot to do with patents and each vendor wanting to control the market
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:24): that's why we still today have few interoperable codecs and container formats supported between the major media players
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (02:24): is the root problem vendors wanting control or competition?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:26): the root is probably vendors wanting control, since that creates a lot of competiton from other vendors wanting control
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (02:26): ironically, the solution to such problems is often *more* competition instead of less.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:26): although, choice can be good. Different codecs are optimised for different situations
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:27): just like we have PNG, GIF and JPG for different types of images, the video container formats and codecs are good for different uses
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (02:28): PNG probably wouldn't exist if it weren't for (now expired) patent concerns
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:28): like Ogg, I think, is good for streaming, whereas Matroska is good as a general purpose container format
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:28): PNG is superior to GIF in many ways, including lossless compression and transparency, so it probably would
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (02:29): I'm not so sure.  Supperior design is an outcome of what competition produces, but if GIF were "good enough", there might not have been such an effort.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:30): in fact, the usefulness of GIF has shrunk significantly, especially in light if APNG being slowly adopted
